intro: Gomidesia casarettoana, commonly known as the Casaretto's gomide, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of central Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has a compact, bushy growth habit with narrow, gray-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun exposure, making it well adapted to its harsh native environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
